name: Ape About Dracula Quiz | Horror Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text: In which of these movies was Dracula (Lon Chaney Jr) stranded after his coffin was burned?
questions.explanation:
Son of Dracula.

	Kay had married someone who called himself Count Alucard (Lon Chaney Jr).  Frank Stanley (Robert Paige) set fire to Dracula's coffin after someone noticed that "Alucard" was "Dracula" spelled backwards.  When the sun rose, Dracula had no coffin to return to, so the sun turned him into a skeleton.  There may have been other movies in which Dracula's coffin was burned, but this was the only one in which Lon Chaney Jr played as Dracula.

questions.text: In which of these movies did Dracula need virgin blood?
questions.explanation:
Andy Warhol's Dracula.

	In the comical but sometimes violent movie "Andy Warhol's Dracula", Dracula had to leave his home because he needed virgin blood, and there were no more virgins in that area.  Dracula claimed to be a wealthy aristocrat when he temporarily moved in with a landowner who needed money.  When the landowner was away, Dracula bit one of the landowner's grown daughters, but her blood made him sick, because she wasn't a virgin.  Later, he bit another daughter, but she also wasn't a virgin, and he got sick again.

questions.text: In which of these movies did Dracula kill someone and then seduce the man's granddaughter-in-law?
questions.explanation:
House of Frankenstein.

	In "House of Frankenstein" Dracula (John Carradine) killed Burgomeister Hussman (Sig Ruman) because Dr. Niemann (Boris Karloff) wanted revenge for being put in prison.  Dr. Niemann had resurrected Dracula by pulling the stake out of his skeleton.  Then Dracula seduced Hussman's granddaughter-in-law Rita (Anne Gwynne) by giving her his ring.  After Dracula died in a wild chase when the sun came out, the ring fell off her finger, symbolizing that Dracula had lost his control of her.

questions.text: In the movie "Blood of Dracula's Castle" who played as Dracula's butler?
questions.explanation:
John Carradine.

	In the movie "Blood of Dracula's Castle" (1969) John Carradine's character helped resurrect Dracula and his vampire bride by giving them blood from victims he captured at Dracula's castle.  Of course, John Carradine played Dracula in a few movies, including "House of Frankenstein" and "House of Dracula".  He also appeared in "Johnny Guitar", "The Howling", "Grapes of Wrath", and "Everything You Always Wanted to Know About Sex But Were Afraid to Ask".  His sons were David, Robert, and Keith Carradine.

questions.text: In which movie was Dracula impaled on a cross?
questions.correct: Dracula Has Risen From the Grave (1968)
questions.explanation:
Dracula Has Risen From the Grave (1968).

	In the movie "Dracula Has Risen From the Grave" two priests went to the castle to make sure Dracula hadn't moved back into it.  One priest stuck a large metal cross over the doors to the castle, because Dracula couldn't touch the cross without getting burned.  The other priest stayed lower on the side of the mountain, but he cut himself on the jagged rocks, and some of his blood dripped through a crack in the ice, into the mouth of Dracula (Christopher Lee), who had been trapped and frozen in the ice in the previous movie. After Dracula was resurrected, he possessed the priest whose blood resurrected him and got him to help remove the cross from the doors and possess the niece of the other priest. When the cross was removed, it fell partially down the mountain with its pointy top sticking up.  Later, Dracula had a fight with someone and fell from the castle onto the pointy top of the cross.  Dracula's hands burned when he touched the cross to pull himself off of it.  Dracula turned into a red dust.

questions.text: In which of these movies was Dracula resurrected after someone drank Dracula's blood?
questions.explanation:
Taste the Blood of Dracula.

	"Taste the Blood of Dracula" began by repeating how Dracula died at the end of "Dracula Has Risen From the Grave". A man collected the red dust which was all that was left of Dracula.  Later, three respectable British businessmen went to a wild place one night to get drunk, and a man told them they could live forever if they drank the blood of Dracula. They went with him to a deserted church.  The mystery man cut his hand and sprinkled his blood into the red dust, which made it all liquefy.  He drank some of the blood and offered it to the businessmen.  They refused to drink it and ran away when the man started choking. The choking man fell to the floor, rolled around, and became Dracula (Christopher Lee).

questions.text: In which of these movies was Dracula struck by lightning?
questions.explanation:
Scars of Dracula.

	At the beginning of "Scars of Dracula" blood dripped out of a bat's mouth into Dracula's mouth.  This resurrected Dracula.  Dracula captured a young woman to romance at his castle, but she wore a cross necklace which kept him away.  At the end of the movie he had a fight on the roof with someone while holding up an iron bar during the thunderstorm.  Lightning struck Dracula.  Dracula burst into flame and fell off the castle.

questions.text: In which of these movies did Dracula fall on stakes?
questions.explanation:
Dracula A.D. 1972

	This movie brought Dracula into modern times, with some young Satan worshipers bringing Dracula back to life.  One of them was the granddaughter of the new Dr. Van Helsing (Peter Cushing).  Dracula (Christopher Lee) killed a few people before capturing the young woman.  Van Helsing lured Dracula into a trap, where he pushed Dracula into a pit full of pointy stakes sticking up, which supposedly killed Dracula.

questions.text: In which movie did Lionel Atwill play as Inspector Holtz?
questions.explanation:
House of Dracula.

	Lionel Atwill played as Inspector Holtz.  The villagers demanded he arrest Larry Talbot (Lon Chaney Jr) or Dr. Edelmann (Onslow Stevens) for a recent murder.  Holtz said he needed more evidence.  Holtz had previously seen Larry become the wolf man, but Dr. Edelmann told Holtz that Larry had been cured.  However, before Dracula (John Carradine) was destroyed, Dracula had put some of his blood into Dr. Edelmann, which gave the doctor a split personality.

questions.text: In the movie "Dracula: Dead and Loving It", who played as Dr. Van Helsing?
questions.explanation:
Mel Brooks.

	In the Mel Brooks version of the Dracula story, "Dracula Dead and Loving It", Mel Brooks played as Dr. Van Helsing who helped people fight Dracula (Leslie Nielsen) when Dracula caused trouble for the British characters played by American actors.  Of course, Mel Brooks is famous for directing "Young Frankenstein", "Blazing Saddles", "Spaceballs", "Life Stinks", and "The Producers".
